headline: Goodbye, gas! Why this electric boat is making waves
summary:
STORY: Carving silently across Lake Mead, a reservoir situated about 30 minutes southeast of Las Vegas, Nevada, this boat offers a glimpse of a future where water sports leave nothing behind but a clean wake.

The all-electric wake sport boat is part of its creators' bold bet that the marine world is ready to go electric.

:: Carbon Shift

Built by California-based startup Arc and designed by a team of former Tesla and Rivian engineers, the 23-foot Arc Sport EV brings Silicon Valley to the water.

Mitch Lee is the co-founder of Arc.

:: Mitch Lee, Co-founder and CEO of Arc

“It's a fully electric wake sport boat, 23 feet, 500 horsepower. It has a giant battery on board and it gives you hours of fun out on the water without any of the fumes, any of the of noise, any maintenance burdens of a gas boat."

“On the water, the Arc Sport gives you an experience that is quieter, you don't have the fumes from a gas engine. It's more performant, you have so much more power and torque available to you. It's all software enabled, and it's actually cheaper to operate. More convenient to charge a boat overnight than it is to lug gas cans down to the dock. And then once you take it off of the water, you don't have the maintenance headaches, you don't need to winterize it."

According to Lee, on a single charge, the boat can handle four to six hours of active use, with an overnight charge on a Level 2 charger delivering a full battery by morning.

Beyond the powertrain, Arc leans heavily into software.

“With one touch of a button, you can configure the balance system, the control surfaces, the cruise control for it, to throw that perfect surf wave on one side of the boat or the other."

"I think that electric boats make even more sense, that electric cars have pretty stiff competition in gas cars. Those gas cars are reliable, they're inexpensive, they are convenient, they are quiet, they've had a bunch of money put into R&D over the span of 100 years. Gas boats are not the same level of competition. And by going electric, you solve a bunch of very acute pain points with owning a gas boat."

But Arc's technology comes at a premium.

The Arc Sport EV boat starts at $268,000.

Yet Lee says demand has not been an issue, with the wake sport boat being just the beginning.

“We've already announced our next product that comes after this, which is a center console boat for fishing and leisure activities, and have also expanded into the commercial space as well. Larger vessels, harbor craft, you can think of tugboats and ferries, so taking that same technology and scaling it up to those applications."

headline: Nvidia’s $4 Trillion Stock Rally Faces More Threats Than Ever
summary: Nvidia Corp. shares are down 9.1% since hitting a record on Oct. 29, well underperforming the S&P 500 Index, as investors grow concerned about the sustainability of artificial intelligence spending and the chip giant’s grip on the market.  The recent drop is notable considering that on the day the stock last closed at an all-time high, it was up more than 1,300% since the end of 2022 and Nvidia’s market capitalization was over $5 trillion compared with roughly $400 billion less than three years earlier.  Meanwhile, the dominant AI chipmaker is facing more competition than ever before from rivals like Advanced Micro Devices Inc., as well as its biggest clients, including Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. And Wall Street is growing increasingly worried about Nvidia’s investments in many of its customers, which could be seen as artificially propping up demand.

content.title: Nvidia’s $4 Trillion Stock Rally Faces More Threats Than Ever
content.summary: Nvidia Corp. shares are down 9.1% since hitting a record on Oct. 29, well underperforming the S&P 500 Index, as investors grow concerned about the sustainability of artificial intelligence spending and the chip giant’s grip on the market.  The recent drop is notable considering that on the day the stock last closed at an all-time high, it was up more than 1,300% since the end of 2022 and Nvidia’s market capitalization was over $5 trillion compared with roughly $400 billion less than three years earlier.  Meanwhile, the dominant AI chipmaker is facing more competition than ever before from rivals like Advanced Micro Devices Inc., as well as its biggest clients, including Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. And Wall Street is growing increasingly worried about Nvidia’s investments in many of its customers, which could be seen as artificially propping up demand.

headline: Why Elon Musk And Tesla Aren't 'Losing Sleep' Over Nvidia's Self-Driving Announcement
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk launched a flurry of social media posts on X following Nvidia's announcement Monday that it was launching its own autonomous vehicle AI, and planned to test a robotaxi taxi service with unnamed partners by 2027.  At the CES conference in Las Vegas on Monday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced Alpamayo, Nvidia's autonomous vehicle AI system, which will come to the U.S. in Q1 2026 available in certain Mercedes-Benz vehicles.  Huang added that the plan is to roll out the autonomous vehicle system in Europe and Asia after the U.S. launch.

content.title: Why Elon Musk And Tesla Aren't 'Losing Sleep' Over Nvidia's Self-Driving Announcement
content.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk launched a flurry of social media posts on X following Nvidia's announcement Monday that it was launching its own autonomous vehicle AI, and planned to test a robotaxi taxi service with unnamed partners by 2027.  At the CES conference in Las Vegas on Monday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced Alpamayo, Nvidia's autonomous vehicle AI system, which will come to the U.S. in Q1 2026 available in certain Mercedes-Benz vehicles.  Huang added that the plan is to roll out the autonomous vehicle system in Europe and Asia after the U.S. launch.

headline: Lidar Stock Soars 33% After Nvidia Taps Supplier
summary: Shares of lidar maker  Aeva Technologies  surged early Tuesday after the company said it had been selected as a lidar supplier for  Nvidia  autonomous-vehicle platform.  The jump followed a Monday announcement that Aeva was selected to be a lidar supplier for Nvidia’s DRIVE Hyperion autonomous vehicle platform.  DRIVE Hyperion allows automakers to build self-driving cars using Nvidia’s hardware and software, rather than developing those systems from scratch.

content.title: Lidar Stock Soars 33% After Nvidia Taps Supplier

DRIVE Hyperion allows automakers to build self-driving cars using Nvidia’s hardware and software, rather than developing those systems from scratch.

headline: Tesla Stock Could Be Worth Just $80
summary: On Saturday, former Fidelity portfolio manager George Noble posted a sum-of-the-parts, or SOTP, valuation for Tesla on X, which suggested the electric-vehicle maker was worth $80 a share.  Tesla rose 3.1% on Monday, closing at $451.67, while the  and  gained 0.6% and 1.2%, respectively.  Coming into Monday trading, Tesla’s stock had declined for seven consecutive trading days.

headline: Elon Musk Says 'We Have Entered the Singularity' Declaring This The Year AI Becomes Smarter Than Humans — And Everything Changes Forever
summary: Elon Musk didn't say we're getting close. He said we're already there. The Tesla and SpaceX CEO on Sunday replied to two separate posts on X with one unmistakable claim: "We have entered the Singularity." Hours later, he followed it up with a second post: "2026 is the year of the Singularity." Both were in response to engineers marveling at what AI tools can now do—cranking out years of work in weeks and reshaping how software is built. We have entered the Singularity— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) Janu

content.title: Elon Musk Says 'We Have Entered the Singularity' Declaring This The Year AI Becomes Smarter Than Humans — And Everything Changes Forever
content.summary: Elon Musk didn't say we're getting close. He said we're already there. The Tesla and SpaceX CEO on Sunday replied to two separate posts on X with one unmistakable claim: "We have entered the Singularity." Hours later, he followed it up with a second post: "2026 is the year of the Singularity." Both were in response to engineers marveling at what AI tools can now do—cranking out years of work in weeks and reshaping how software is built. We have entered the Singularity— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) Janu
